Hi @jarben , you can use `center` property. like this example https://ecomfe.github.io/echarts-examples/public/editor.html?c=map-locate

And for the new version, which will be released soon. You can use `boundingCoords`, for example:
```js
boundingCoords: [[-180, -90], [180, 90]]
```
will show full world map.

Not show if it can satisfy your requirements

Thanks @pissang for your reply, sorry my description wasn't very clear, the scenario is more about centering other series types (such as pie chart) on the map. For example: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/561365/24092382/3d59877a-0d4e-11e7-9dbf-cc5b49e39501.png)

This can be achieved by using geo.dataToPoint(latlong), however, this requires a special handler which handles zooming and roaming. 

It would be nice if any position can be specified as lat long which would automatically position it on the map (using geo:{}) settings. 

For pie chart, it would be something along these lines:  

center:["lat(14.43302)", long("50.079128")]

The lat() long() syntax is to differentiate from numbers such as [14.43302,50.079128] which is currenlty handled as pixels. 

It's basically a declarative way to position anything on map.

Aha, seems i gave an answer which has no relationship at all. 

Yes it will be very useful, and we are thinking out a way to put a component, like pie in your example, on a specified coordinate system like geo. For example:
```js
pie: {
    coordinateSystem: 'geo',
    center: [14.43302, 50.079128]
},
```
Or even further, we can put a coordinate system on another coordinate system.
```js
grid: {
    coordinateSystem: 'geo',
    left: 14.43302,
    top: 50.079128
}
```

But there is still no plan when to add this feature :(

@jarben I had requested this for the bar charts a while back: https://github.com/ecomfe/echarts/issues/1346#issuecomment-78251683

As you suggested, it would be even better if it's available to all text. Additionally, it would be great to expose the methods that can calculate the text length and bar length in px. With that info, you can add logic to either place the labels inside or outside of the bars, for instances where the label is longer than the bar length.

是的，我刚也遇到和楼上完全一样的问题：我用的操作系统是window7。ECharts version [ECharts 版本]: 3.4.0 ,[zrender]:3.3.0 ，在Firefox42.0和Chrome 55.0都可以正常运行，在IE11.0.9浏览器上运行requestAnimationFrame调用报错  “调用的对象无效” ，尝试使用Polyfill 发现没用，因为echart内部使用的是var requestAnimationFrame = require('./requestAnimationFrame'); 自已引入的requestAnimationFrame 方法

这个问题参考：
https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender/issues/189
http://www.foreverpx.cn/2017/03/04/echarts_webpack_ie/

这个问题已经解决了，去掉对象中 stack: '总量'这个字段就好了
@pissang 我修改了源码，给line图添加了brushSelector: 'point'，目前看来是可以支持刷子筛选的，但我不知道这里会有什么风险，能否说明一下，谢谢。

You need to remove `areasStyle`, in ECharts, line series with `areaStyle` will be drawn as a area chart

感谢您的回信，前段时间业务需求是要针对（柱状图数据量大，且有下拉框）添加搜索条件 来帅选数据，但是用户希望可以将图列放在条件后面，可是那样一个是搜索条件div+html构建的，而用echarts的柱状图，会出现在柱状图下拉框移动时，而搜索条件没有跟着动，而出现了搜索条件在柱状图下面，影响显示！
